message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think you'll really love it! I'm willing to sell it to you for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Can you meet me halfway?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob! I can do $140, but I think you'll really appreciate the value of the product at this price. It's a fair compromise, don't you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice. However, I'm still a bit above my budget. Can you do $130?
I'm glad you're still interested in the product, Bob! I can do $135, but I think it's getting close to my minimum price. Let's meet in the middle, shall we?
I'm getting close to your minimum price, Alice. I'll meet you halfway again. How about $132.50?
You're really pushing me to my limits, Bob! I can do $137.50, but I'm not sure how much more I can budge. This is getting close to my minimum price, and I'm starting to think about other options...
I understand you're getting close to your minimum price, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $135, but I'm not sure I can go any higher. Can you make one more concession?
I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm really not comfortable going any lower than $139. This is my final offer, and I'm willing to walk away if it's not acceptable to you.
